column13: We enjoyed Arizona Restaurant Week at the Relish. The meal was outstanding. The servers were very friendly. This is more of an upscale sports restaurant with a great view of the Phoenician Golf Club.

column1: Bob's Steak and Chop House - Omni Tucson National Resort
column13: Nice bar menu at happy hour, killer filet with blue cheese and honey. Patty Lea

column4: 10999 N. Frank Lloyd Wright Blvd Scottsdale, AZ  85259
column13: Vito's is a great neighborhood restaurant. The food is delicious, service is surpurb, and the portions generous. I've been there several times and I have enjoyed every meal.
Good food and service...generouse portions. This was our first visit to the restaurant....we'll be back.

column4: 10455 E Pinnacle Peak Pkwy (Not Pinnacle Peak Road) Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: A great dining experience. Excellent food, outstanding locale and attentive service all combine to make Sassi one sassy location.

column1: Bourbon Steak at The Fairmont Scottsdale Princess
column13: The best of trip into Arizona, clearly a restaurant that prides itself on attention to detail in preparation, execution and service..

column4: 20751 N. Pima Road Suite 120 Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: We have dined here before (appetizers and dinner) and feel like we did the last time... the food is good, the service is good but it seems to be a bit pricey. Perhaps it is the North Scottsdale pricing. We think we might return just for happy hour...

column4: 2905 E. Skyline Drive Suite 168 Tucson, AZ  85718
column13: The wine and the service were very good, though we expected a greater wine selection from a wine bar. Food, was just so-so. Much better food when we first discovered this cafe a few years ago. Fast-food quality now.

column4: 16091 North Arrowhead Fountains Center Peoria, AZ  85382
column13: This was a birthday dinner for our oldest two kids (grown-ups now) who share a birthday - so 12 people, kids, etc.
Had a very good dinner and will come back again sometime.

We enjoy Arrivederci although the tables are close and it can get quite noisy when crowded. We always receive attentive service from waiter Giovanni. The pesto sauce for the rolls is very tasty. The food is always served piping hot. We heartily recommend Arrivederci.

Food was not as good as it used to be. We ordered the prime rib medium rare to preserve the tenderness but it did not have much flavor. Waitress asked us if we wanted a loaded baked potato and we asked for sour cream and chive, not thinking that butter was an option. Once it was requested of her we had nearly finished our meal before it was brought to our table. We have always enjoyed our meals there but something was lacking this time.
Our waitress was outstanding during a busy time. We were seated quickly and everything was great.

Overall, our experience was good. We originally had a reservation for seven. We had someone cancell an hour before. I contacted the restaurant to let them know. When we arrived, they were ready to seat our party immediately. We were a party of six, they sat us in a booth that "fit 6". We spent the evening in tight quarters. I wouldn't have been as bothered by this, except that they sat parties of two in booths as big and bigger than ours.
Good food, friendly staff and a pleasant dining experience.
Everything was perfect, food was great, our server was excellent.We Will be back again

Fantastic new Italian place with a classic menu. The family is very present and cares a ton for their customers. It's super nice to get that kind of service and food. We sat outside and loved the cocktails and dinner.

Back on top after a rough couple of years. The Som has updated the menu & restaurant intoBistro type setting with two different price ranges less expensive in the front during lunch& back room higher $$. .Good idea ! Fun again

The service is very good but the food is terrible. The sea bass dish, the shrimp dish as well as the beef burro dish are just bland and covered with sugary sweet sauce. This is no Mexican cuisine. We all had apple crisp for dessert and they are ok.
Fantastic 4 course meal offered for reasonable price. Happy hour menu is also delicious!

Rude, Rude, RUDE!!! We made reservations on-line for 2:30pm, the site would have allowed me to set the reservation until at least 3:15. We arrived at 2:40 and were told that we were too late. We asked to talk with the manager who also told us that we were too late and that the computer was off and so he could not accomodate us. We tried to tell them that the web-site would have allowed us to set the reservation up to at least 3:15, however he kept telling us that the computer was off and there was nothing he could do. We had driven about 100 miles, down from Prescott, with one of the goals to try this particular restaurant. NEVER AGAIN !!!! Next time we'll try the Brazilian Restaurant in Scottsdale, as long as their not connected.

column4: 36889 N. Tom Darlington Dr Carefree, AZ  85377
column13: Even though the outdoor dining is basically in a parking lot, it offers a great mountain view. The noise on weekends in the winter months can be loud with all the motorcycles out riding. But otherwise, lovely. Nice outdoor fireplace for cool evenings.

Were greeted politely by the hostess, brought to our patio table, water right away. After about 10 minutes Lindsey came out and asked if we were served yet and we said no. This was our second time at the restaurant, Lindsey was our waitress the first time. We asked if she could be our waitress, she said she had to check. She came back, apologized for the delay and took our order. The meal was great.

column4: 34505 N. Scottsdale Road, Suite G2 Scottsdale, AZ  85262
column13: perfect weather for outdoor dining on the restaurant's attractive outdoor seating
We took friends there for their first visit. They LOVED it... and so did we.

column4: 300 East Wigwam Blvd Litchfield Park, AZ  85340
column13: A couple of items to address. When booking through Open Table the restaurant was named Red Allen's, when we walked through the hotel to find it, we were told it was Reds Bar and Grill which was a bit confusing. Also, the menu listed Panko breaded fish and chips, which ultimately turned out to be regular fish and chips...not breaded in Panko.

We had a group of 10 and were seated in the "glass room." The server was outstanding, and she lowered the level of music in that room so we could all chat. Usually we are unable to chat as a group because of the noise level in other restaurants. The food was excellent and commented on by all of the first-timers in the group.

column1: Cave Creek Smokehouse & Pour House Patio
column4: 6245 E Cave Creek Rd Cave Creek, AZ  85331
column13: Food quality was good, meat was tender, not fatty. The meats did not have much of a smoky taste, but the sauce made up for that. Coleslaw was dry.

We had a very pleasant evening. Our waitress was very good and responsive to all our requests. All of the staff that we encountered were very pleasant and we felt they genuinely cared about our dining experience.
We went to the restaurant for my sisters 8th birthday and she LOVED it!!! The chef interacted very well with the whole table.
Wonderful, tasty, delicious food. It was a great family style place for our party of six.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Chandler
column13: Food was good and had a very nice wine list...

column4: 3111 W. Chandler Boulevard Chandler Fashion Center Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: Open diring major reconstruction, looked and felt weird.

This is one of the few places in Phoenix I would order seafood at. The fish I had was excellent but at the end of the day, the value is not there for the amount you get. The tiger shrimp appetizer, while delicious, has little value. Four small wontons for shrimp that costs 6 bucks a pound and its 10 dollars. Again, excellent service and ambiance, value for the price just isn't there for me. Still recommend.
Our server Missie was excellent. Attentive but not overly attentive. Vegetarian tacos were good but the tacos themselves were too thick.

column4: 3717 E. Indian School Rd. Phoenix, AZ  85018
column13: Each time we try a dish we haven't ordered before. Beckett's Table doesn't disappoint.

I was given a gift certificate to L'Auberge as a retirement present. It was a superb experience and we thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful outdoor setting by the creek. The service was perfect and the food was absolutely delicious! Thank you.

column4: 7042 E. Indian School Rd. Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: As always great food. It is a tad bit smokey if you get stuck by the Kitchen. Not good on the allergies
Really enjoyed out first time at the restaurant. Great, wine, cheese and dinner! We had a very friendly and helpful waiter and will be back for dinner before our next date to the Opera!

column4: 2502 E Camelback Road, Suite 102 Phoenix, AZ  85016
column13: Truly an amazing dining experience. Highly recommend the tasting menu with accompanying wine pairing. A fantastic experience. Service is top notch - attentive without being overbearing. Quiet and relaxing. Don't pass this up.

Food is bland and greatly overpriced. Cocktails are expensive and 75% of most restaurant pours. Sounds are abrasive; we asked that the speakers be turned to lower decibels. Far better fish restaurants elsewhere in Scottsdale at much lower prices.

Fabulous glass scupltures decorating the interior! This was my first time here but will definitely return the next time I am in the area. Just recommended to someone who is heading out to Phoenix this week. Love the location, just wish I would have planned to arrive sooner to do some shopping before dinner...next time!!

We went for our anniversary. They had confetti on the table and took our picture, then gave us a nice copy with a card signed by the staff. Very nice touch. My wife has several food allergies and they were very accommodating.

column4: 15323 N Scottsdale Rd suite E1-160 Scottsdale, AZ  85254
column13: Delicious food and good wine. Lively bar. Formal or casual dining.
Honestly the BEST enchiladas I've ever tasted in my life!!

Had a wonderful dinner and our waiter Juan could not have made it more enjoyable! Everyone was attentive without being intrusive. Juan added just enough humor to make the evening perfect! They very generously gave us a piece of cheesecake to celebrate our anniversary, and it was the best cheesecake I have ever had!

This place had really tasty food. I highly recommend the mussels which have buttery white wine sauce with the perfect amount of jalapeÌ±o spicieness. The pork stew was also nice...tender and flavorful. For the entrees the crispy salmon was delightful. I also highly enjoyed the short ribs which were really tender, slightly smokey and sweet. The fish tacos were very good and tasted fresh. Another nice dish was the lobster pasta entree which light creamy sauce. Service was good, although 1 of the servers had a slight attitude. Ambience was nice and we were able to watch the Sunday night football game. They also a decent craft beer list.

column4: 1840 S. Val Vista Dr. Mesa, AZ  85204
column13: New spot to the area. Staff was friendly and made great suggestions. Food was outstanding especially the wild mushroom tamale. We will be back!

column1: Rita's Kitchen at Camelback Inn, A J.W. Marriott Resort
column13: Food was good, but not outstanding. Drinks are great. Menu limited.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - DC Ranch
column4: 20753 N. Pima Road Bldg. R Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: Decent service, good Manhatten but very poor quality steaks. They could not possibly been prime. The Capital Grill is much better

Very nice. We hadn't been here for several years and thought we'd stop back in for a Friday dinner. We started at the bar for a couple of their specialty martinis and ended up talking to the "new" owner who had bought it since we had been there last. She was very nice and was interested in our input and feedback. The drinks were OK, nothing spectacular, but the food was excellent. We will definitely return. A nice change of pace from PF Changs.

Industrial meets urban-chic-trendy type of atmosphere. Nothing to buffer the sound so it can be difficult to carry on a conversation. Service was good; waitress very knowledgable about menu offerings as well as cocktails. Innovative and creative menu - maybe too much so. High prices for small portions. Flatbread was uninspiring; mac & cheese was more appetizer size than entree size. Pineapple Upside Down cake was yummy.
Our server was fantastic and the food was delicious. I had heard it was very expensive but for the food, service and ambiance, it was perfect. We will be back!

column1: Taste- An American Bistro at The Hilton Phoenix Chandler
column13: THEY DIDN'T KNOW HOW TO CHECK ME IN WITH OPEN TABLE, SO I'M SO HAPPY TO KNOW IT WAS ACCOMPLISHED THE FOLLOWING DAY.

column4: 10355 N. LaCanada Dr Oro Valley, AZ  85737
column13: an overall fine experience with ok surroundings in a neighborhood strip mall. Food is tasty, ample portioned and well-prepared (perhaps a touch too much salt but that is common in US it seems.) Half price wine nights are a great deal to complement the meal.

column4: 6107 N. Scottsdale Rd Suite 110 Scottsdale, AZ  85250
column13: I ordered the Vegetarian Plate, which was outstanding (despite the boring name). The dish was beautiful to look at and the vegetables in the terrine melded with the orzo and marinara to create wonderful flavors. Servers were attentive and friendly.

column4: 28234 N. Tatum Blvd Cave Creek, AZ  85331
column13: Fabulous food, service and wine. Our Scottsdale favorite!!!

Made reservations for our anniversary, did not feel uncomfortable dressed up in a suit and tie. The. Service was excellent, food was a great experience. Super cool dining room. Be sure to check out the library next door.

column1: Palm Court at The Scottsdale Resort
column13: Some of the best table side service at any restaurant we have ever been too. Banana's Foster prepared table side was off the chart. Great summer 5 course wine pairing at great price.
The service was good but the atmospere was a little lacking. Wobbly tables were a little off putting.

Great food and even better service. Based on previous reviews we can say that if your lucky enough to get Branko as your wait person, you will be extremely satisfied with his attention to details. He provided us with good guidance on size of the sides and salads. We shared a Ceasar salad and a desert (which neither of us needed). All in all, we definitely will return.
It had a very nice atmosphere and great staff, but overall the food should be the main focus but that it left us very unsatisfied. We would most likely not eat there again or recommend it.

My husband has been following Jose's career for 15+ years now. Living on the east coast, we frequent his restaurants whenever we're in Philly and we're never disappointed. So when we visited Scottsdale, we HAD to eat at Distrito. First of all, it's a tapas menu, so we were able to order multiple plates to share, which is a good thing considering that it's so hard to choose. The service is phenomenal. The staff is incredibly knowledgable and will happily make recommendations. They have a tequila menu that can't be beat, as well as heavenly margaritas. If you like fish, get the mahi magi tacos....so good! And the plantains are the best I've ever had. We will definitely be dining here again the next time we're on Scottsdale.

We visited the restaurant from Phoenix (a four hour trip) while on vacation, including renting a larger car for long ride, took our son and another guest, to celebrate our thirtieth anniversary (which we notified them ahead of time) and thoe service was just awful. We had to wait fifteen minutes for a server to come to our initially, we had to wait at least thirty to forty-five minutes between courses, no refills of our water, we had to pour our own wine, we were given no special dessert, etc.Very disappointing for spending a thousand dollars on the evening!!We will not return even though we have made the four hour trip from Phoenix while on vacation from the east coast every year for the past seven years.Over priced, and awful service!!

column1: Tii Gavo, a gathering place at Enchantment Resort
column13: Very nice venue with a nice casual menu in Boynton Canyon.

column4: 7555 E. Eagle Crest Dr. Mesa, AZ  85207
column13: We ate there the last few days before a scheduled renovation. They had all of their menu items available on their standard menu but there was still enough choices. The food was excellent and the service was friendly and efficient.I can't wait for them to reopen.

One of the oldest steak and seafood restaurants in the Valley, and always consistently good. Great old-school steakhouse atmosphere with red brocade wallpaper and leather booths. Don't forget to order the Strawberry Shortcake for dessert - out of this world and one of their signature desserts. Amazing wine list!
We are experimenting with a vegetarian diet. There were two entries on the menu and both were excellent. We have been to Tarbells many time and the food and service are wonderful.

It was our first time to Avanti's. We heard about the decor, food and service and people either love it or less then like it. We took friends and had a really great time. We liked the fact that the menu included dishes very few restaurants serve. That was a treat. My chicken melted away, tender, thick cut, moist and 2 large breasts. 1 came home with me. The pasta was only warm, not hot. We also thought the usual dishes (found everywhere) were about $4 more than other like-kind restaurants charge. Overall the experience was good and we will be back when we are salivating for one of the hard to find menu items.

A wonderful dining experience. We dined outside just at sunset and the view and food were excellent. Our waiter, however, was extremely slow bring second bottle of wine after two of our party had finished our meal and "forgetting" to bring a cappuccino until after everyone else was finished with their coffee and desserts. Our friend refused the cappuccino and had the waiter take it back. It still showed up on our bill however. In the waiter's defense, the restaurant was slammed and the waiter was very busy. He did apologize for being slow and offered a 10% discount on the bill, although it still showed the cappuccino! I think the waiter may have been new. We would eat here again on another trip to Sedona.
The chef is outstanding and is very creative in his dishes.

We had a memorable dinner. Our guests that came with us said it was the best dining experience and food they have had in a long time. Jeff, our waiter was awesome. He remembered us from a previous visit, welcomed us back and did a superb job serving us. We enjoyed the evening and didn't want to see it end. We are looking forward to returning!
Noisey, Noisey, Noisey......We love the place but will only go on Monday or Tuesday when it's a liot quieter. You can;t ever have a conversation on Fridays.
Great salsa made at your table, and a very varied menu to explore.
Enjoyable family reunion dinner. Salsa making at the table a big hit.

column4: 2224 E Williams Field Road Gilbert, AZ  85295
column13: Great food. Great service. Waiter did a great job even helping our 7 year old with her sushi and making sure she was entertained. Very busy night with homecomings in the area but all the food came out timely and hot.

column4: 7500 E. Doubletree Ranch Road Hyatt Regency Scottsdale Resort and Spa at Gainey Ranch Scottsdale, AZ  85258
column13: This was my second time and it was even better than the first. If you go, you MUST get the Goldolina dessert--it is perhaps the best dessert I have ever ordered, and it is relatively cheap!

column4: 6770 N Sunrise Blvd Suite G-211 Glendale, AZ  85305
column13: When you walk in and the first person you see is the hostess and she can't even greet you with a smile it turns you off completely! I even tried to joke with her and nothing! It was 115 outside and she asked us if we wanted to sit outside... Really? Then she seats us and plops down the menus and walks away! Our waiter took his time to get to our table he was ok nothing special. Once we received our sushi it was sub par nothing great I think for the price it should of been a whole lot better, presentation was sloppy. The vegi ramen was great but my teriyaki salmon was horrible. I would try it again to see if things are better and only order the soup. They really need a nice hostess that knows customer service and knows how to smile.
My lunch salad consisted of iceburg lettuce, a smattering of black beans and chicken and Kraft low fat salad dressing. In short, I would have been happier at Mc Donalds.
very accommedating when i needed to change reservation time---cash discount was a nice surprise

column1: Primo at the JW Marriott Starr Pass Resort & Spa
column4: 3800 W. Starr Pass Boulevard Tucson, AZ  85745
column13: Some dishes worked, others didn't. Overall disappointing and not a good value for the expense.
Great service and good wine list.

column4: 8280 West Union Hills Road Suite 110 Glendale, AZ  85308
column13: We love the great service and the food here and this time was no different. Took friends there for their first time and they too were impressed with the food here. Will be back soon!
I was disappointed that they had changed their menu

column1: BLT Steak at Camelback Inn, A JW Marriott Resort
column13: it was too dark. we had to take out our flashlights off our phones to read the menu.
Just really great food!! ...very unique approach in serving Indian food compared to other restaurants in the Phoenix Area...

column4: 413 N. San Francisco St. Flagstaff, AZ  86001
column13: The restaurant did not honor your reservation. They called me the next day, said they got the reservation, but would need to seat us at the bar because they were already full.Nice restaurant though.
Excellent diiner. We will return!

column4: 7111 E. 5th Ave Ste. E Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Staff was friendly, attentive, and the food was good.

column4: 4991 S. Alma School Rd. Ste 1 Chandler, AZ  85248
column13: We really loved the food, looking at the menu we thought okay nothing special, but then the dishes came out and we can't say enough about the dishes. Really great food.

I was looking for a classy place in Flagstaff to take my boyfriend for his birthday, and I stumbled upon the website for this restaurant. The location is rather tucked away in downtown Flagstaff, but it definitely gives off an extraordinarily enchanting feel. The servers are very polite and knowledgeable, and the food was unbelievably perfect. This place is not cheap, but if you're looking to go somewhere special in Flagstaff this is definitely the perfect place.
Loved everything about Cowboy Ciao!!

Everything we ordered was very good. If I had to stack them, however, I would put thegnocchi at the bottom. Gnocchi is always a challenge, though. The puddles were a tadheavy, but the sauce was heavenly. Butterfish was to die for, and the raw dishes wereoutstanding. Wine list is a big, fat 10.
Excellent in every way! Has never disappointed.

column1: Deseo at the Westin Kierland Resort & Spa
column13: Beet salad was terrific. Kitchen made a special vegetarian meal for us. It was outstanding. My only recommendation is that the veg dish should be on the regular menu.

column1: Nellie Cashman's Monday Club Cafe at The Westin Kierland Resort & Spa
column13: Although service was sometimes slow the wait staff made up for the kitched's slowness
Large portions and large selections to choose from. Unfortunately did not save room for dessert but they looked very good.
Everything about Local Bistro was great , food, service, ambiance. Just a bit noisy .

column4: 5532 North Palo Cristi Road Paradise Valley, AZ  85253
column13: Lovly place. My no. 1 or 2 in Scottsdale. Wine are too expensive. Markup of wine slightly too high. 3-4 time from store; But still highly recommened.

Restaurant was very slow on the day of my reservation. There were probably six guests in the restaurant. Unfortunately, the waitress and bartender were more interested in talking then serving the few guests they had.
We love the Specialty Pasta dishes and the live entertainment on Saturday nights!

This is a GEM among GEMS in a quaint old phoenix House probably built in the 1930sIts the first BYOB of AZ and deserves the serious attention among Wine devotees who live among Arizona's archaic corkage restrictions (ie no corkage).The servers (all women) have matured with the restaurant over the years and have now become very attractive mature Women up from just attractive young cheerleader types all of whom make you feel comfortable in a home-style way.The food is great tooIts a place to bring your wife,a business associate, your mother or your grandchildren as well as a date (whatever be your station in life)
Pastiche remains our favorite restaurant in Tucson. The food is consistenly great, the service is even better.

This was a special occasion marking our 17th anniversary. I made the reservation on line and put in my requested services, good table, special occasion, etc. The hostess was perfect (accent as well) in accomadating my every request and the waiter was fantastic. They sat us outside at a perfect table next to the fireplace. It was a cool evening and a beautiful setting. This is now one of my favorite spots. The service was slow paced, with a perfect wine reccomended by the waiter. Each course was a culinary delight and I could not have asked for anything more. We arrived at 7 and left at 10. I did not want the evening to end. Thanks for everything you perfect little French gem.

The last reviewer was right - this place is ridiculously dark! In a strip mall, its funny. I ordered a steak cooked rare and it tasted like it was seared with propane. Ick. Service was great, but food was bad.

column4: 6166 N Scottsdale Rd Ste 701 Scottsdale, AZ  85253-5442
column13: Cannot find fresher ingredients on pizza and crust that you eat every bit. It's fun to watch the chefs knead the dough and bake the pizza in the wood burning oven. Chefs and staff could not be more friendly. An overall, enjoyable experience.

column4: 7167 East Rancho Vista Drive Unit 111 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Great place but hard to see where it is at night.
This is the first time I've used opentable and I'm truly impressed at how easy it is. I will try to use it as much as possible. Thanks!
very attentive staff. food was prepared perfectly.

column4: 10637 N. Tatum Blvd Suite 101B Phoenix, AZ  85028
column13: Has the feel and friendliness of a small European restaurant (we had just returned from Spain). We had Oso Bucco and Paella, both were prepared perfectly and portions were just right so we did not feel overstuffed and had no bags for the "dogs". Prices were just right, good value. We will definately return.

If you are tired of the typical checklist of rolls and nigiri in Japanese sushi restaurants (as my wife and I are), you won't find one here. But if you love eating creative dishes (works of art, really) with tasty, fresh ingredients and fantastic flavor combinations, you will love it!

column4: 1425 N. McCulloch Blvd. Lake Havasu City, AZ  86403
column13: Second time did not disappoint. Everyone in my large party complimented the food and the view!
As always, great food and service. I was there for brunch for my birthday and was treated by the server to a delicious b'day dessert! Thank you so much!
Thanks Open Table!! blind shot at a sushi place on our visit to PHX/Scottsdale and Roku is a hit!!!

column4: 15257 North Scottsdale Road Suite F-230 Scottsdale, AZ  85254
column13: I love this place. I've dined here (3) times in the last month. Twice for lunch and once for dinner and have not been disappointed. The food is very, very good and the service is impeccable. I also think the decor is fabulous. All around great restaurant. As a matter of fact, I'm having dinner there again tomorrow.

column4: 7114 E. Stetson Dr. Suite 210 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Fantastic tapas. Great live entertainment (Spanish music & dancing).
Delicious food in an intimate setting. Perfect in every way!
The food and service is excellent. Very friendly atmosphere. The owner actually came to our table to chat. Definitely give it a try.
Food did not seem to be their forte, but that's understandable given that they are more of a night out place. I would go back for drinks/starting the night off, but not for dinner.

We loved the table prepared gucamole appetizer and the braised rib tacos to share! When we want to do something special for ourselves concert or plays in Scottsdale we will include always dining at the Mission first.

column1: Tommy V's Urban Kitchen and Bar Scottsdale
column4: 7303 E Indian School Rd. Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: We were looking for a restaurant to take our friends to. Tommy V 's exceeded all our expectations. All our entree's were delicious. The service was outstanding. I would give them 5 stars. Thanks for a great dining experience.

column4: 2 N. Central One Renaissance Sq Ste 102 Phoenix, AZ  85004
column13: The chili was good; the salad was out of a bag with dressing and store bought croutons. the macaroni and cheese was suggested and it was good, but not very hot. Overall, the place was extremely low key sports bar type place...we did not need a reservation.

column4: 15411 W. Waddell Rd Suite 108 Surprise, AZ  85379
column13: We love Vogue Bistro! We have never been disappointed by the food or the service. It has a great vibe and we look forward to going there because we know we will be having a great time.Maria
The only disappointment was we were there for lunch to celebrate my mothers birthday and they don't give a complimentary dessert.

column4: 8 S. San Marcos Place Chandler, AZ  85225
column13: They brew superb beer, it should be the only reason to go... but it's not! The food is fantastic it is one of our favorite places.
Their food and service were outstanding! Sorry it seemed that the place was not half full. Maybe they have a better turnout @ lunch.

column4: 6370 N Campbell Ave Ste 160 Tucson, AZ  85718
column13: The patio was crowded and the live music was excellent but very loud. We sat inside where for much of the time we were the only customers. Nonetheless, the service was attentive and we found it very pleasant. The menu is limited, but both of us enjoyed what we had (I had the meatloaf, she had a caprese salad). Only about half of the wines on the list were available (the others were crossed out), and what we drank was mediocre. We will be returning, but will not order wine next time.

Excellent food! We were really impressed to see the large table nearly right out in the dining room where they were making homemade pastas. It was so interesting to watch! And then tasting the pastas was delicious! Truly a unique place and very good quality.
Our first visit was very impressive. Wonderful menu.

column4: 3645 W. Starr Pass Blvd. Tucson, AZ  85745
column13: My wife and I ate here with some friends on a Saturday evening and were pleasantly surprised by the outdoor seating and view it had to offer. Food was great and had a variety of great choices. We all oredered somthing different and were all pleased with our food. I can't wait to go back!

column4: 300 E. Wigwam Boulevard Litchfield Park, AZ  85340
column13: My husband and I were staying at The Wigwam for our 1yr anniversary and had dinner at Litchfield's. It was romantic, warm, inviting, and lively. Everyone from the hostess, bussers, and server was very friendly and engaging. My husband chose one of the specials that night, the Mexican Grouper, and I had the NY Sirloin with Gouda mac 'n cheese, and green beans. Our food came quickly, it was hot, and absolutely delicious! The only small area for improvement would be in the bread and butter. The bread was a bit too crunchy and the butter was cold/hard. My husband and I were very pleasantly surprised when the bill arrived. For bread, 2 entrees, a glass of wine, and a margarita, we only paid $81 before tip. We will definitely be going back!

column1: Kai - Sheraton Wild Horse Pass Resort
column4: 5594 W. Wildhorse Pass Blvd Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: Best Arizona dining experience!

column1: Ko'sin Sheraton Wild Horse Pass Resort
column4: 5594 W. Wildhorse Pass Blvd Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: We dined here 3 different times this week while we were on Fall Break. Every single meal was delicious! Brandon was our server and he was fun, energetic, and helpful. The charcuterie tray was delicious, the gnocchi was the best I have ever had. My husband and sons had the most beautiful steaks I've ever seen. I loved this place. 2 things fell short; the tables need to be wiped down after each guest more thoroughly and my bolognese sauce was very dry on one of the evenings. I am not one to complain, but decided to do so to Brandon and without asking, he brought me extra sauce, and discounted my meal. We also ate at the Sunday Breakfast buffet and loved it! I can't tell you how wonderful this restaurant is.

We spent a couple of nights at Casino del Sol for my wife's birthday present. One night we dined at PY. My wife had the crab cakes for an appetizer and though they were excellent. Both of our filets for the main course were grilled to perfection - this restaurant got it just right. The waiter (Levi) was very knowledgeable about the wines and was extremely helpful in our selections. The wine specials, some hard-to-find South American wines, were good bargains. We look forward to a repeat visit.

We were looking for a place to eat on a Friday evening. Coach & Wiilie's showed up on Open Table so we decided to give it a try. We were sat almost immediately in a room beyond the bar. The noise level wasn't too bad - typical sports bar noise. Then about two minutes later a deep base pounding started. There was a karaoke set up in the area beyond the room. We sat for ten minutes without being acknowledged by any of the employees that walk past our table. The pounding base was getting annoying - never heard anyone singing. We decided to leave without ever getting to try the food. The menu looked like it had good items on it too. Don't know if we would attempt another visit but it definitely would not be a Friday night.

We escape to Tucson and the Arizona Inn in late summer, and we make a point of booking the Kingfisher for Friday night. The dining area is quiet and private, even though open; and it has the look and feel of a comfortable neighborhood gem. The service this time, as always, was prompt and professional. The red snapper special for the evening was beautifully presented and did not disappoint. The wine selection is wide, and even the offerings by the glass are high quality.
the food and the service were simply outstanding.
The food is always wonderful! All dishes are VERY flavorful and the chef is not afraid to use spice. Soi Four is consistent and is fantastic always! Ask for Chris - he's a great waiter.

The ambiance in the restaurant is lovely, with all the exposed brick, and most interesting lighting fixtures. Our dinners were delicious, but the STAR is their homemade ice cream! One by one, as the four of us tasted it, we all said "Oh, my God!" This is without a doubt the finest tasting ice cream that any of us has ever had -- bar none!
best mole we have ever eaten including multiple trips to various locations in Mexico!!!
This is a gem of a restaurant and all the positive reviews are accurate. The food was great, the service excellent and the prices were fair. You wont walk away hungry.
Love this place more and more everytime i go. This is a fantastic place to take someone special.
Great atmosphere. Limited menu. Overpriced.

column4: Arizona Biltmore 2400 E Missouri Phoenix, AZ  85016
column13: Took my friend here for his Birthday. William was our waiter and he was wonderful. Very professional and knowledgeable. The menu was fantastic and the food even more so. Thank you for making it an evening to remember for us.
The appetizers were good, but the entrees were very average. I know you can do better
Great servir. It was a jolly good show. The food was absolutely marvelous mate

I love this place... no other way to explain it, it starts with being greeted by Buzz and it's all up hill from there! It's not just dinner it's a outstanding dining experience I know only recommend this place I make sure I take all my friends and special guests there for the experience!!!!

column4: 400 N. Toole Ave Suite 100 Tucson, AZ  85701
column13: Terrific food. Neat to watch the trains go by as you eat a delicious meal.

We decided to take advantage of the Monday $5.00 burger and were not disappointed. We have dined at McMahon's in the past and have always had great food and service. I don't know what they do to hamburger meat to set it apart from any other burger in town, but they are full of flavor and come with the usual condiments. We ordered one order of fries for three people because we just wanted a taste, not a carb overload and were very satisfied with the fries as they came to our table piping hot. Great meal.

column4: 1730 South Val Vista Drive Mesa, AZ  85204
column13: food tasted great but was only warm when arrived at our table. Server didn't stop to ask how things were.
Our first visit and we were very pleased. The fried pickles were interesting.

column4: Arizona Biltmore 2400 E. Missouri Phoenix, AZ  85016
column13: Only nice thing was the food. Apart from this the server was new and lacked confidence. In Open Table I put in a note that stated the dinner was a night out for husband and wife, requesting a romantic table/view. We where sat directly next to the bar, close to a noisy kitchen line and a server station. To top off the evening the main courses took 30 plus minutes to arrive. The server tired to comp a dessert which didn't repair the experience because I had to request the comp, this should have been offered.
They're gluten free friendly and very accomodating. Thank you!

column4: 10885 N. Frank Lloyd Wright Blvd. Scottsdale, AZ  85259
column13: All the food kind of tasted the same. Huge quantity but poor quality. Maybe I could recommend as a place to grab a beer an natchos after a golf game, at best.
Atmosphere, food, and service was excellent.

column1: District American Kitchen and Wine Bar
column13: The food is OK, but the wine list is not great.

column4: 7014 E. Camelback Road Suite 1433 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Over rated! The food here was some of the worst our table of four had experienced at a restaurant who touts its beef and seafood. All of us tried the . $67 Waygu steaks and they were sub par, raw oysters had a "fishy smell" and tasted terrible, and the mushroom side had been drenched in salt. Our server was the saving grace of this over priced dining experience.

We have dined at Prado many times and this was the first time it was not excellent. I ordered a filet, which is no longer on the menu but our server told us they "had a few left." I should have known. It was dry and overdone although I ordered medium and it should have had a pink center. It was not juicy and delicious and perhaps I ordered the wrong item.We also ordered the dolce dessert with bacon (please leave that on the new menu!) and it was great but took a very long time coming.I preferred the previous menu to this new one but it is an exceptional setting and we will be back.

column1: Steak House at Desert Diamond Casino
column13: Terrific as always. Food was great and had a nice visit with Chef Michael.Looking forward to our next visit.
We have been here several times and have enjoyed each. The food is consistently very good and offers a very good variety. The wine list has an obvious Italian leaning, with good offerings.

column4: 15024 N. Scottsdale Rd, Suite 160 Scottsdale, AZ  85254
column13: Went with my husband for our anniversary dinner. We were looking for somewhere nice, but not too fancy, and NoRTH was just right. We ate outside at the Bar NoRTH area, and it was great. It was noisier inside, so we were happy we ate outside. The food was great, the server was very polite and helpful, and it was overall a good experience. Definitely recommend!
Great happy hour - good service and good food.
Quiet evening with friends. Good food. Service was exceptional.
We had fajitas and seafood enchiladas. The fajitas were good, but not better than others we have had. The red sauce on the enchiladas was not one that I cared for.

column4: 7135 E. Camelback Road, Suite 195 Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Great service and really well prepared food in a setting that is perfect for a Sunday brunch with family and friends. Thank you open table for making it so easy to set up and modify reservations, they went off without a hitch

column4: 5455 East High Street Suite 115 Phoenix, AZ  85054
column13: EXCELLENT!!! Oysters were great. Steak and lobster delicious and the pumpkin ravioli for our vegetarian friend perfect, as well. The bar area was so nice that we ate in the bar area and enjoyed the live music. And the truffle butter popcorn was at the bar was a nice snack. Happy Hour food and beverages were a great value too. Will be going back regularly.
Excellent food, excellent service

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Peoria
column13: This was my first time dining at Fleming's and I was impressed. The food was delicious, but the "cherry on top" was the excellent service provided. I have not dined at a restaurant with such excellent customer service. They really care about their customers and go out of their way to ensure you have a great experience.

We had a fantastic experience and very much look forward to going back to dine again. We were greeted promptly, the food was outstanding and just overall a great experience. We went on our 4th year anniversary and The Persian Room made it for an over the top touch. Highly recommended by us and pretty darn reasonable.

column4: 5310 E. High St #101 City North Phoenix, AZ  85054
column13: Food was okay, sushi kind of generic. Waitress was always gone not checking on us. Took forever for drinks and to order.
Roy's has been excellent every time we've been there.

column4: 2201 E. Camelback Road, Suite 106-A Phoenix, AZ  85016
column13: Excellent service and a great dining experience.. Wine list was great but also had a nice list of wine by the glass. Over all a good experience. Would definately go back.

With a constantly changing menu a vegetarian dish caught my eye. This is not a typical dish I would select when there is perfectly good fish and tuna and steak options on the menu. But, I have to say the Autumnal Tasting Plate was awesome. I didn't miss not having any meat and the flavors packed a punch. A real surprise and a testament to the quality of the food preparation and focus on flavors. For any vegetarians out there they have a separate menu with vegetarian options as well.
EXCELLENT SERVICE, FRIENDLY STAFF, USE OF MY LAST NAME BY ALL MAKES IT VERY PERSONAL KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK.
Excellent fresh seafood with great service in a comfortable casual setting. We don't get to Phoenix that often. but when we do, we will be back.

column1: Palo Verde at The Boulders Resort
column4: 34631 N. Tom Darlington Drive Carefree, AZ  85377
column13: Great food, great service and great ambiance. It just doesn't get any better than this. The dining room is just too cool to describe. You won't be disappointed here.

We expected this to be just another run-of-the-mill, resort-wannabe eatery. We were wrong. Our steaks were cooked perfectly (i.e., barely) and were delicious. The spicy shrimp appetizer (Borracho Shrimp, I think they call it) was outstanding; nice and zippy with great flavor. The wine list is rather too heavily Californian, but we found a tasty Washington-state Barbera at a reasonable price. Very good service, too: things happened in a timely fashion, but nobody hovered over us. We're adding PG to our regular rotation.

The hostess wasn't very good at seating, as she sat about 5 tables, including ours all at one time, in one section. The waitress was apologetic and overcame the initial issue. The dining room is beautiful and the patio is really nice. The only "down note" on the patio is the street noise.
Went with friends who were visiting from NY - as always food was spot on and we enjoyed everything.
Great Food, Wine and Service, as usual

The food and service were outstanding. There was a wide variety of dishes available. The vegetable dishes were especially interesting. They willing to modify the spiciness of their dishes to fit your tastes. We intend to return.

column1: Reds at Sedona Rouge Hotel & Spa
column13: I have been here at least 3 times. On this occasion the hotel had a special event/wedding. The restuarant suffered because of it. The food was not nearly as good as the previous 2 times. All we kept hearing was we are busy tonight. The resturant was 3/4 empty.

column4: 13220 N. Eagle Ridge Drive Fountain Hills, AZ  85268
column13: Unbelievable outdoor seating with great views and meal was excellent. A gem tucked away in Fountain Hills... a must for those that want a special dining experience.

column4: 3550 N. Central Ave Suite 120 Phoenix, AZ  85012
column13: As always, great food & service. Very nice!
Service was good food great awesome place. Will go again

column4: 5550 E Lincoln Dr. Paradise Valley, AZ  85253
column13: First time to the restaurant. Now on our list of must go there when in Phoenix. We loved everything about the experience. Family member lives in Scottsdale and recommended it. He has not been there yet. Encouraged he and his wife to experience the restaurant. Exellent food, great service and awesome ambiance and view. What more can a person ask?

column1: J&G Steakhouse Scottsdale at The Phoenician
column13: We had a lovely time at the restaurant---celebrate two birthdays and were surprised with cards and a dessert on behalf of the restaurant. The staff were very attentive. We really appreciated the lovely view and the ambiance---quiet. We could carry on a conversation without screaming:)

column4: 7001 N. Scottsdale Rd Ste 147 Scottsdale, AZ  85253
column13: Average all way around. Lots of fried food and loud live music.

Terrific food! Bad experience for two reasons: First, I was there alone with my wife for a romantic meal. Though many tables were open, we were seated next to a multigenerational family with a baby in tow. We didn't see the baby at first, but she made her presence known. Hostess seated us there because visually it was a prime table- but this was bad on two counts- either the family shouldn't have been seated there, or, we should have been given an alternate table option- she knew the child was there. Next, in between courses, we were asked if we wanted more bread ( I still had a piece on my plate ), and we declined. The next thing I knew everything from the prior course, including the bread and the bread plates disappeared abruptly.

column1: Technique at Le Cordon Bleu ‰ÛÒ Scottsdale
column13: Although the portions are small, they are so well presented and so full of flavor, that it invites savoring each morsel. The total of three courses leaves one quite satisfied. The menu is ripe with choices including wine or non alcoholic drinks. All in all a delightful dining experience for an unbelievable price. Lastly, the cooks and servers are students who aim to please and their enthusiasm adds the final touch.

column1: Rawhide Steakhouse at Wild Horse Pass
column4: 5700 W North Loop Road Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: The food was excellent and the wait staff was superb. The table to table magician was the best we have ever seen. A great time was had by our group. Thank you...
There are only a few places in Phoenix to get good Mexican food - this is one of the best!

column1: Rico's American Grill - Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak
column13: Service started out good then dropped off dramatically. We were abandoned for about half an hour. Food was on par for hotel. Nothing special or memorable. Best part was setting. It's a pretty place. I kept thinking I'd rather have breakfast there.

column1: The Flying V at Loews Ventana Canyon Resort
column13: Hit and miss. My brother was here visiting from San Diego and wanted to try this place. Some of the food was fantastic - Quail, duck confit Tacos, both amazing. The oysters on the half shell should not have been served. Cioppino was good, not great. My biggist probablem was with our waiter. We could not get this guy to stand still, even when we were trying to ask a question. He literally walked away in the middle of my sentence. He only came to the table when he absolutely needed to, never checked on us at all. It became quite a joke and a challenge to see who could get him to stop at our table. I just started asking the hostess for help when I needed something. Too many other amazing restaurants in Tucson for way less money.

column1: Signature Grill at the JW Marriott Starr Pass Resort & Spa
column4: 3800 W. Starr Pass Boulevard Tucson, AZ  85745
column13: We had a excellent dining experience. The service was very good and the dinner was great. The presentation of the meal was outstanding.
wonderful food and service. great ambiance. someone called to inform us of a festival going on and told us where to park to make it easier. very considerate and helpful.

column1: Canyon Cafe at Loews Ventana Canyon Resort
column13: Easy seating and good service. Tacos didn't seem to have much flavor.

column4: 6464 E. Tanque Verde Rd. Tucson, AZ  85715
column13: Nimbus is a good place for a quick meal, no frills, good beers. It's a peppy place with a wide ranging beer menu. The burgers, fries, onion rings, calamari were all good. Not spectacular, but quite acceptable. We noticed later on that beer flights are possible, which would have added more interest to the experience. Too bad our waiter didn't say anything about this.
Second time visit-first time with adult group. This time with 13 year old. Great food. Entertaining. Great experience
Joe did a terrific job!!! We will be back!!!
The food was good but I thought the chef should have put some salt and pepper on the steak and chicken.

We took advantage of a dinner for 4 for $40!! It was very good!! The salad was delicious and was huge and I took some home. The baked ziti was great and after 4 of us ate at it, both couples took some home, and the garlic bread was amazing!! Thank you!!! It was really good and oh.....the waitress, Stephanie, at the Scottsdale location, was exceptional!! Thank you, Buca!

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Scottsdale
column13: Fourth visit and never disappointed. My wife and I have less hearty appetites and the small plates are wonderful, allowing room for desert. We highly recommend this Flemings.

column4: 7014 E. Camelback Road Scottsdale Fashion Square Scottsdale, AZ  85251
column13: Kona is an Always "Go To" where I know I will receive excellent service, food and love the TV's to watch games.

We enjoyed our happy hour experience very much--great food, service and ambience. When the waiter discovered that I didn't care for the fish in my tacos, he brought out tacos with chicken! My husband said his hamburger was delicious. It was one of the biggest hamburgers I have ever seen!

We were seated promptly, but no one even brought us water for 10 minutes. After 20 minutes, a manager finally came over and offered us a round of drinks and edamame on the house. The food was excellent and service was fine during previous meals here.

column4: 7001 N. Scottsdale Road, Suite 290 Scottsdale, AZ  85253
column13: Celebrating my husband's birthday. The food was delicious as usual. The service is attentive. You have to have the filet mignon. No one does it better than them. The asparagus with hollandaise sauce was delicious too. It's always a treat to have dinner here. Expect to spend over $100 for two people.

column4: 15323 N. Scottsdale Rd Suite 195 Scottsdale, AZ  85254
column13: Our server was friendly and courteous, but seemed very overwhelmed, we had the feeling that they were short staffed. It was difficult to catch our waiter's eye to get him to come to our table, which is what we had to do, even to place our order. Also we saw our drinks sitting at the bar for 10 minutes before he remembered/had time to bring them to our table. There was a private party of 40, whose dinner order had gone in right before ours so our meals took quite a long time to come. We were given complimentary guacamole b/c of the wait.That said the food is good, the Margaritas are great and the atmosphere is lively. We've been before and would go back w/ our fingers crossed for a better service experience.
Celebrating a birthday, had a diverse age group that Capital Grill accommodated all. Quality of food and service was exceptional and offered a great selection of wine at a reasonable price.
All was well!! Sever was great!!

Cricket and her team at Z Tejas did an outstanding job of servicing our group of 9 who were there meeting for a charity event. They handled our orders, specific requests with class and professionalism. In addition, the food was outstanding!
The food was outstanding and server was very helpful.
This place was fantastic! Kendal our server was outstanding and everything we ordered was excellent. Definitely give this place a try, total sleeper, but won't be for long after the word gets out.

column1: The Grille at Shadowrock Sedona Hilton
column13: The advertised romantic sunset views are drastically overstated. It is a quiet romantic outdoor location with minimal views. The food was good and the service was not good at all. After appetizers our waiter went on break and handed us off to another server. She showed up with dessert menus thinking we were done but entrees had not yet arrived. I spoke up about pending entrees and she just walked off. After a long wait our entrees arrived. When the tardy check arrived we waited forever for it to return for signature. Whatever peace and quiet we would have had was disturbed with all of the blunders. We were lured in for sunset views so we overlooked all of the bad comments that indeed come true.

column1: Shula's Steak House - Wild Horse Pass Hotel & Casino
column4: 5040 Wild Horse Pass Boulevard Chandler, AZ  85226
column13: We were celebrating our 20th anniversary - and we were very pleased w/everything! The food, the waiters, service, and of course, the chocolate cake to celebrate our anniversary. I would give you a 10!Bob Clement
My parents come into Tucson about twice a year and we always enjoy the food here. Keep up the great work and good food!
Excellent steak! Friendly server..

column4: 8852 E. Pinnacle Peak Road Scottsdale, AZ  85255
column13: The food was fantastic but the noise level made it hard to have a conversation with our party. The piano player and soloist is a good idea but need to sound proof the dining rooom so diners can have conversation during dinner.
Third time at this restaurant for Sunday brunch. Great option in the location. Would definitely return.
Food excellent. Every dish prepared as ordered. Key Lime pie was exceptional.Service was very good. Did not have a long wait for anything.

Heard so much about this place.We didn't realize it was suns per seasonOpener - our food came out quiteQuickly as busy as it was.Eclectic restaurant with fun menu.Didn't have a waiter for the first 15 minutesOr so meanwhIle all around us were being helped.Our waiter finally showed up - he was great onceHe got started.The crab ciopinno was excellent -Fun atmosphere if you like really loudRock and roll.

column1: T. Cook's @ The Royal Palms Resort
column13: Lunch Menu not available on Sunday's. Shellfish Pasta was wonderful.

column4: 2000 E Rio Salado Parkway Tempe, AZ  85281
column13: It was Amazing!! & Thank you to our outstanding server Louis!!
I love everything about Z! The food and service is always exceptional ...never had a bad experience at Z!

Where to start? Food wasn't the best, wasn't the worst. Our server was great. Manager and whomever checked us out was entirely rude and unprofessional. Who can't split a bill for their customers nowadays? And who then can't process multiple credit card payments when it's time to pay. I'll never give this restaurant a dime again.

column4: 28190 N. Alma School Pkwy #209 Scottsdale, AZ  85262
column13: We love this placeand come here often. The service is friendly, food is great and prices are fair.
It is a wonderful experience. Relaxing calming and intimate

On our recent stay at the Canyon Suites at the Phoenician, we had the pleasure of dining at Il Terrazzo for Sunday brunch, twice for breakfast and once for dinner. All of our meals featured a wonderful meal, attentive service and a lovely atmosphere. If the weather allows it, outdoor dining is a must!

column4: 2000 E Rio Salado Pkwy Suite 1041 Tempe, AZ  85281
column13: The food is outstanding and fully met my expectations. I love booths and our location was great. Music and the atmosphere are perfect for dinner dining. The only drawback is the wait time for the food, however I don't mind it because of the absolutely wonderful taste. I will definitely be coming back.
Great food. great service. We will go back.
The food was so great. We did all tapas and wished we had room for dessert! Great beer list.

column1: Top of the Rock Restaurant at the Marriott Buttes Resort
column13: We mentioned in our reservation that we would be spending our anniversary with them (we are both Marriott employees in CA)and only the hostess acknowledged it. It was very disappointing that we spent $125 on service that was not guanine and came off very causal. Our server had food in his teeth and told a few bad jokes. Our salad was over dressed, the ceviche was bland, and my husband sent back his 10 hour braised pork shoulder because he could hardly cut through it! Our dessert didn‰Ûªt come on a dessert plate or complimentary. It‰Ûªs the little things that go a long way. We feel ripped off and are trying to put this experience out of our minds.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Tucson
column4: 6360 N. Campbell Avenue Suite 180 Tucson, AZ  85718
column13: Steak was outstanding, perfectly done. Expensive though. Service was outstanding by all staff. Manager stopped by the table to check on our dinner and provided us with a complimentary additional order of sauted spinach.

column4: 7395 N. La Cholla Blvd. Tucson, AZ  85741
column13: The food and service were great. The only issue I had was when I made my reservation I asked for a quiet private table. We were seated directly next to another group even though other tables were available.

Pleasantly surprised!!! The short ribs and the filet were outstanding. Unique dishes. Salad was great! Desert was delicious. Our server Kelsey was very attentive, great service. I would recommend to anyone!
Great restaurants! Everything was perfect .

column4: 832 S. Greenfield Rd Suite 101 Gilbert, AZ  85296
column13: food is amazing as always. Great to have a nice small Italian neighborhood resturant.
Excellent service! Highly recommend the ravioli as an appetizer or meal! Will definitely visit the next time we are in the Scottsdale area!
they were in process of changing the wine list and as such the selection was very poor.
Very nice and relaxing spot --- out of the mainstream and serving very good food at a reasonable price. Owner takes pride in making this a customer friendly place to kick back and zone out!

I did enjoy my experience at The Wrigley Mansion for Sunday Champagne Brunch for my birthday. The service was excellent and the champagne was free flowing. My glass was constantly full. That was great! I'm giving the food an ok because the omelet/pancake station was slow because one man was working both. They were both good though. Some of the food wasn't kept very warm and I'm not sure why. It was served in Dutch oven pots vs. warming pans and so the food didn't stay warm. I was a little disappointed with some of the food because it was under seasoned and I don't like to add salt to my food. I would have enjoyed more ready made breakfast foods, like French toast or crepes. Overall, it was a great experience and I would return.

Service was top notch. As other reviews have said, you can ask for items off the menu and they will accommodate. First time there and a very pleasant experience. Would recommend and will definitely go back.
This is our favorite place in town, it has every thing to lift our spirits and enjoy a very delicious meal with very reasonable prices.
Our first time in, we loved it. Moderate prices, great wine list, a varied menu. Service was great, good music, on a nice warm Saturday night - the place to be!

A great place for fresh seafood. From SF Bay Area and the fish at this restaurant far surpasses anything at Fisherman 's Wharf. We had seabass and Ahi Tuna. Seabass grilled with just lemon juice. Excellent stayed moist throughout. Ahi prepared to order with light touch of soy dressing. I had the freshest tasting Oysters on the halfshell as an appetizer. These were New England oysters and were briny tasting as they had just been harvested and opened. Everything is al carte. Nice Brussels sprouts and fresh asparagus made great sides. The service us top notch. Eric was our server and he did a great job. The place is high energy with a noisey bar so you need to be seated in the booths away from the bar if you're looking for quiet dinner talk.

column4: 16335 W. Northern Ave Litchfield Park, AZ  85340
column13: Dillon's at the Zoo is a West Phoenix hot spot. Their BBQ dishes are excellent and they provide excellent service. The dining room is attached to a huge aquarium and you can watch sharks and other fish while you dine. We were there on a Friday night and there is usually a waiting line. Luckily we had reservations through Open Table. If you get a chance get a half order of onion rings for only $1 as an appetizer. My favorite is the BBQ St. Louis Ribs. They offer 3 kinds of bbq sauces, mild, cajun, or sweet heat. I prefer the sweet heat with a little kick. Another favorite is the Wedge, a wedge of lettuce with Blue cheese, bacon, smothered in a Blue cheese dressing.
